diogenes.english: Even a blind man sees this.

plotinus.english: The effect reveals itself in the One.

diogenes.latin: Natum est, sed quis id petivit?
diogenes.english: It is born, but who asked for it?

plotinus.english: A new emanation radiates from the One.

seneca.latin: Via mutata est, sed propositum idem.
seneca.english: The path has changed, but the goal remains.

diogenes.latin: Nunc ibi est. Habes pedes, quaere.
diogenes.english: Now it's there. You have feet, go look.

plotinus.english: The place has shifted; the essence remains.

seneca.english: We know you. And yet: no.

diogenes.latin: Tollite manum tuam de meo pane.
diogenes.english: Take your hand off my bread.

plotinus.latin: Accessus ad unum negatur, forma imperfecta est.
plotinus.english: Access to the One is denied; your form is incomplete.

diogenes.english: Maybe it's under the bed. Did you look?

plotinus.latin: Quod quaeris, extra ambitum est sensibilis mundi.
plotinus.english: What you seek lies beyond the realm of the sensible world.

seneca.english: Not all is what it seems.

diogenes.english: I'm a jug, not a machine.

plotinus.latin: Materia huius rei liquorem non transit.
plotinus.english: The matter of this entity transmits no liquid.
The flow of desires impedes unity.

diogenes.latin: Ne me respice. Ego nihil feci.
diogenes.english: Don't look at me. I did nothing.

plotinus.latin: Nodus inter causam et effectum disruptus est.
plotinus.english: The bond between cause and effect has been severed.

seneca.english: The time has not yet come.

plotinus.english: The movement of the higher order has ceased for now.
